meanings.definition: The quality or state of being isochronous.
meanings.sent1: The isochronisms of the clocks in the house made it easy to keep track of time.
meanings.sent2: The isochronisms of the pendulum clocks synchronized perfectly in the room.
meanings.sent3: The isochronisms of the alarm clocks going off at the same time startled everyone awake.
meanings.sent4: The isochronisms of the metronomes ticking together created a mesmerizing harmony.
meanings.sent5: The isochronisms of the heartbeats in the quiet room sounded like a rhythmic drumbeat.

meanings.definition: A phenomenon in which two or more events occur at the same time or in equal intervals.
meanings.sent1: The isochronisms of the thunder and lightning during the storm were both frightening and fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The isochronisms of the dancers' movements with the music captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The isochronisms of the car horns honking simultaneously caused a chaotic symphony on the street.
meanings.sent4: The isochronisms of the synchronized swimmers' routines were a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The isochronisms of the fireworks bursting in the sky created a dazzling display of light.

meanings.definition: The presence of equal time intervals between events or actions.
meanings.sent1: The isochronisms of the train arrivals at the station kept the schedule running smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The isochronisms of the traffic lights changing helped regulate the flow of cars.
meanings.sent3: The isochronisms of the students handing in their assignments at the same time surprised the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The isochronisms of the waves crashing on the shore created a calming rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The isochronisms of the raindrops falling at a steady pace lulled me to sleep.
